question.title: EOF errors in Spring Boot under load with traditional vs virtual threads (Vegeta)
question.body:
I'm testing the performance of my Spring Boot API and running into a problem I can't figure out alone.

Context:

  • Server: macOS M2, 8 GB RAM, running Spring Boot 3.x and Java 21

  • Client: i5 PC sending requests

  • Network: Local, low latency

  • Test goal: Perform 5,000 requests in 10 minutes using Vegeta

  • Experiment: Testing both traditional threads and virtual threads (Project Loom) on the server

Issue:

  • I can only achieve around 3,000 requests in the same period.

  • Many requests fail with EOF errors:

Post http://192.168.1.16/threads/traditional: EOF

  • The API itself doesn't crash, but seems limited by threads, JVM, or Spring Boot configuration.

Vegeta command used:

echo "GET http://192.168.1.16/threads/traditional" | vegeta attack -duration=10m -rate=<rate> | vegeta report

Questions:

  1. Has anyone experienced EOF errors in Spring Boot under load with Vegeta?

  2. Could this be related to traditional vs virtual threads, connection limits, or JVM tuning?

  3. How can I adjust the API or Vegeta to reach 5,000 requests in 10 minutes without hitting EOF?

  4. Any recommendations for monitoring threads/connections to identify the bottleneck?

Any tips, configurations, or insights are greatly appreciated!

Thanks!

question_comments.body: The question doesn't provide details of the API nor debugging details. Also you mention number of threads but didn't provide any number nor a thread dump. There could be many possible causes but the question is missing enough information to help.
